Text:
of Basic Education 2014
88  CHAPTER 4 ECONOMIC GEOGRAPHY OF SOUTH AFRICA 
Mind the Gap CAPS Grade 12 Geography
Chapter
4
PWV (Gauteng)
This is the largest industrial region in South Africa.
Factors favouring industries
â¢ Large markets
â¢ Plenty of skilled and unskilled labour
â¢ Many different kinds of raw materials
â¢ Well-developed transport routes
â¢ Access to money (capital from banks and investors)
Kinds of industries:
â¢ Chemical factories
â¢ Iron and steel factories
â¢ Food and drink (beverages) factories
â¢ Motor vehicles
Southwestern Cape
This is the third largest 
industrial region in 
South Africa.
Factors favouring 
industries:
â¢ Access to a  
shipping port
â¢ Factories have  
been here for a long 
time due to historical 
reasons, such as the 
arrival of the early 
settlers
â¢ Plenty of skilled and 
unskilled labour
â¢ Availability of farming 
products
Kinds of industries:
â¢ Clothing and 
footwear factories
â¢ Food processing 
factories
â¢ Fish canning and 
packing factories
â¢ Wine making

2

3
Port ElizabethâUitenhage 
(Nelson Mandela Bay)
Southwestern 
Cape
Durbanâ Pinetown 
(Ethekwini)
PWV (Gauteng)
DurbanâPinetown 
(Ethekwini)
This is the second largest 
industrial region in South 
Africa.
Factors favouring industries:
â¢ Access to a shipping port
â¢ Large markets
â¢ Plenty of skilled and 
unskilled labour
â¢ Many different kinds of 
raw materials
â¢ Well-developed transport 
routes
â¢ Access to money (capital 
from banks and investors)
â¢ Good water supply
Kinds of industries:
â¢ Food processing factories
â¢ Sugar refining (making 
sugar from sugar cane)
â¢ Motor manufacturing
â¢ Oil refining (making petrol 
from crude oil) 
â¢ Chemicals factories
Port ElizabethâUitenhage (Nelson Mandela Bay)
This is the fourth largest industrial region in 
South Africa.
Factors favouring industries:
â¢ Access to a shipping port
â¢ Factories have been here for a long time due 
to historical reasons such as the arrival of the 
early settlers
â¢ Plenty of skilled and unskilled labour
â¢ Availability of farming products 
Kinds of industries:
â¢ Motor vehicle factories
â¢ Leather goods factories
â¢ Textiles factories
Figure 
4.2.1A: South Africaâs four industrial regions
